info.title: Take Care API
info.description: This document describes the REST API interface to TakeCare.

post.description: Log in (optionally in a certain role to a certain unit) and get a authorization token back.

user.description: Username of the user logging in. Usernames are case insensistive.

method.description:
Authentication method:
  * `1` - password is a base64 encoded password
  * `3` - password is a refresh token received in the ticket property of a login response.

roleId.description: The id of the role to use when logging in. By default, or if roleId is 0, the user gets logged in with a union of all roles and is authorized to the union of all authorizations the different roles have. You can then use the roles property in the response to allow the user to chose a role, and a care unit which that role is authorized to, which then can be set for the session by calling /loginAt.

careUnit.description: The care unit id of the care unit to log on to. If you set this to a valid care unit id, the user will be considered logged on to this unit for the session (or until you call /loginAt to log on to a different unit). If you do not supply this value or call /loginAt, you must supply the query parameter fromCareUnit with every call to show which care unit you are making the request from.

id.description: Id of role. Note that the id is specific for this user.

name.description: Currently unused, always the empty string.

validFromDate.description: Date as an integer on the format YYYYMMDD from which the role is valid (inclusive). If the role has always been valid, this property is null.

validToDate.description: Date as an integer on the format YYYYMMDD unitl which the role is valid (inclusive). If the role will always be valid, this property is null.

employedAtUnitGroup.description: The care unit group the user is employed at in this role.

name.description: The name of the care unit group

authorizedToCareUnitGroups.description: List of care unit groups, whose care unit members  the user is authorized to log on to in this role.

name.description: The name of the care unit group

authorizedToCareUnits.description: List of individual care units the user is authorized to log on to in this role.

authorizedToCashRegisters.description: List of cash registers the users is authorized to log on to in this role.

items.description: Session id as an array of signed bytes.

sessionToken.description: Session id as a hex string. Used to authenticate when sending requests after logging in.

ticket.description: Refresh token used to log in again if the session expires.

403.description: Invalid combination of user and password.

422.description: Password isn't a valid base64 string or user isn't authorized to log in to the supplied care unit.

post.description: If you don't supply a care unit or role when logging in, you can use this call to set a care unit and role for the active session. If you do not set a care unit for the session by calling /loginAt, you need to tell the server from which care unit a call is made by supplying the *fromCareUnit* query parameter with every request.

roleId.description: Role id of the user's role to use

careUnit.description: Care unit id to log on to

units.description: List of care units this role is authorized to log on to

422.description: User isn't authorized to log on to the supplied care unit

get.description: Gets a timestamp generated by the Take Care Server. Can be used for testing. Requires no login.

localTime.description: Current date according to server on format YYYYYMMDDHHmmSS e.g. year month day hour minutes seconds.

get.description: Gets the emergency ledger from Take Care server.
Gets the activities from Take Care server.

performedDateTime.description: At what time the activity was performed (yyyyMMddhhmm).

plannedAt.description: At what point in time the activity was planned to be performed. Must correspond to an element in the plannedAt collection in the corresponding activity.

post.summary: Mark patient activity as not performed.
post.description: Mark patient activity as not performed.

performedDateTime.description: At what time the activity was not performed (yyyyMMddhhmm).

plannedAt.description: At what point in time the activity was planned to be performed. Must correspond to an element in the plannedAt collection in the corresponding activity.

commentToWhyNotPerformed.description: An optional comment explaining why the activity was not performed.

get.description: Gets the administrations from Take Care server.

400.description: One (or both) of fromDate and toDate are not valid dates

get.description: Gets the measurements from Take Care server.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Date from which data should be collected (inclusive) in YYYYMMDD format, e.g. 20170201

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Date until data should be collected (inclusive) in YYYYMMDD format, e.g. 20170301

400.description: One (or both) of from and to are not valid dates

ok.description: Error code indicating type of error

arrivalDateTime.description: Date and time when the patient arrived.

term.description: The term describing the reason for visiting

responsibleCareUnit.description: The care unit responsible for the patient

id.description: The id of the care unit

name.description: The name of the care unit

shortName.description: The short name of the care unit

careTeam.description: The id of the care team (1-99) within the care unit.

id.description: The id of the care unit

name.description: The name of the care unit

shortName.description: The short name of the care unit

careTeam.description: The id of the care team (1-99) within the care unit.

shortName.description: The short name of the priority

colourRGB.description: A 3-element array with the RGB code of the colour used to display the priority in Take Care.

items.description: The R/G/B code of the colour

activities.description: The activities for the patient that needs to be done.

doctorVisitAtDateTime.description: Date and time when the doctor visited.

isNextPatient.description: True if this patient is marked as next patient, otherwise false.

dischargeDateTime.description: Date and time when the patient was discharged.

isAffectedByDisaster.description: True if this patient is affected by disaster, otherwise false.

admissionStatus.description:
Status:
 * `0` - not answered
 * `1` - unlikely enrollment
 * `2` - likely enrollment
 * `3` - patient has been moved to another care unit

movedToLocation.description: Id of care unit chosen as patient destination after emergency room visit. 0 = none chosen, -91: out (home), -92: another care unit, -95: referred (hänvisad), 1-999999999: care unit ID.

isNotSecret.description: True if information about this patient can be handed out, otherwise false.

replyStatus.description:
Status:
 * `0` - there are no replies (no envelope)
 * `1` - there are read replies (open envelope)
 * `2` - there are unread replies (closed envelope)

hasApprovedCareContact.description: True if the patient has an approved care contact, otherwise false.

id.description: The id of the care need

name.description: The name of the care need

shortName.description: The short name of the care need

hasNurseSignal.description: True if this patient is marked with a signal to nurse, otherwise false.

status.description:
Status:
 * `0` - Patient is still in the emergency
 * `-1` - Removed/moved to history
 * `-2` - Cancelled

emergencyDocumentID.description: Id of the corresponding emergency document in the patient's record.

created.description: Information about the creation of this activity.

dateTime.description: Date and time when the activity was created.

lastSaved.description: Information about when the activity was last saved

dateTime.description: Date and time when the activity was last saved.

explanationInstruction.description: Instructions or a descriptive comment made by a user.

linkedDocument.description: A document that this activity is linked to.

id.description: The id of the document type.

name.description: The name of the document type.

signed.description: An object describing the signing of the document.

dateTime.description: The datetime for when the document was signed.

locked.description: An object describing the locking of the description in the activity.

dateTime.description: The datetime for when the description in the activity was locked.

completedSetBySystemDateTime.description: The datetime for when the activity was performed.

completedSetByUserDate.description: The date set by the user for when the activity was performed.

completedSetByUserTime.description: The time set by the user for when the activity was performed.

plannedAt.description: At what points in time the activity is planned to be performed. To limit the size of the collection, only items for yesterday, today and tomorrow are returned. Single activities (frequency type id 0) always only have one element.

date.description: The date when a specific activity is planned to be performed.

time.description: The time when a specific activity is planned to be performed.

id.description:
The id of the frequency type.
  0 - the content property contains a FrequencySingle object
  1 - the content property contains a FrequencyDaily object
  2 - the content property contains a FrequencyScheduleDay object
  3 - the content property contains a FrequencyScheduleWeek object
  4 - the content property contains a FrequencyContinuous object
  5 - the content property contains a FrequencyIrregular object

name.description: The name of the frequency type.

basedOnActivityId.description: The id of the activity that this activity was based on.

administeredDosage.description: A list of all administered dosages. This array normally only has one element, except when the administered medication order is for a mix/solution.

items.description: The dosage that was administrated to the patient.

administeredDosageText.description: A list of all administered dosages as text which includes the dosage unit. This array normally only has one element, except when the administered medication order is for a mix/solution.

administrationDateTime.description: Date of when administrated in format YYYYMMDDHHMM

administrationOccasion.description: Text of the occasion when the drug was supposed to be administered, according to the version of the medication order used to administer. This can be e.g. "Dialysis" or "Day of surgery".

comment.description: Comment made by the user who administered the drug.

doseForm.description: Name of dosage form i.e. if drug is a pill, solution etc. This array normally only has one element, except when the medication order is for a mix/solution.

preparationText.description: Name of the drug administered. This array normally only has one element, except when the administered medication order is for a mix/solution.

prescriptionTime.description: Time of when the drug was ordered to be administered in 24 hour format

savedAtCareUnit.description: Name of care unit where saved.

savedAtCareUnitId.description: Id of care unit where saved.

strengthText.description: Strength of all drugs, in text format. This array normally only has one element, except when the administered medication order is for a mix/solution.

items.description: Strength of drug as text to display.

MeasurementIndexEntry.description: A single measurement value and a reference to the document it was stored in. The properties key, documentId and auxKey together define the document the measurement was created by.

careUnitId.description: Id of care unit where measurement was saved

documentId.description: Id of document where measurement was saved. Measurements can be saved both as independent documents and as a part of a case note. Note that document ids are unique for a given patient, but not globally unique.

eventDateTime.description: Date and time when measurement was recorded.

numDecimals.description: Number of decimals (e.g. number of digits after the decimal point) the value should be displayed with. This is important to be able to store e.g 4.20 without simplifying it to 4.2 on display, which would hide information on how precise the measurement was. A value of 0 means no data on the number of decimals, and to use default formatting.

status.description:
Status:
 * `0` - Nothing special
 * `1` - This value has a comment
 * `2` - Value was outside reasonable limits for this term when registered
 * `3` - Value both has a comment and was outside reasonable limits

termId.description: Id of the term the value is for (e.g. 101 for Temperature)

ok.description: Sends back ok status. 1 means accepted, any value that isn't 1 means not accepted.

fullName.description: The full name of the user.

shortName.description: The short name of the profession.

singularName.description: The singular name of the profession.

pluralName.description: The plural name of the profession.

id.description: The id of the care unit.

name.description: The name of the care unit.

times.description: The times for when the activity should be performed.

items.description: A time when the activity should be performed.

times.description: The times for when the activity should be performed.

items.description: A time when the activity should be performed.

isPerformedOnDays.description: The days of the week when the activity should be performed.

times.description: The times for when the activity should be performed.

items.description: A time when the activity should be performed.

irregularDateTimes.description: The date times for when the activity should be performed.

items.description: A date time when the activity should be performed.

fromDate.name: fromDate
fromDate.description: Date from which data should be collected (inclusive) in YYYYMMDD format, eg. 20161231

toDate.name: toDate
toDate.description: Date until which data should be collected (inclusive) in YYYYMMDD format, eg. 20170131

fromCareUnit.name: fromCareUnit
fromCareUnit.description: The unit the user is logged in to. This is used to filter the result based on authorizations between units. If supplied, this value overrides the unit you have logged in to by POSTing to loginAt.

linkedDocId.name: linkedDocId
linkedDocId.description: If supplied, only documents linked to the document with this id will be returned.

takecare_auth.name: Authorization
takecare_auth.description: We use Bearer authorization, so the contents of the header should be "Bearer {{token}}" where {{token}} is the sessionToken you received in the response to your login request.

415.description: Unsupported media type. You didn't set the Content-Type header to application/JSON when POST-ing data.

422.description: Unprocessable entity. The request was syntactically valid but did not validate. Maybe a care unit id or a date you have provided is invalid.

500.description: Unexpected error. The server has experienced an unexpected error which has been logged.

502.description: Bad gateway. The API gateway could not reach the TakeCare server.

503.description: Service unavailable. The TakeCare is currently performing a snapshot backup and has not processed your request. Please retry the request in 15 seconds.

badRequest.description: Bad request. The request body contains invalid JSON that cannot be parsed or cannot be decoded as UTF-8.

authRequired.description: Authentication required. You sent a request that requires authentication (i.e. you need to be logged in) but you didn't send an Authorization header or the session token you sent as part of that header has expired. Log in or refresh your session token by using the refresh ticket you got as part of the login response, and try again.

forbidden.description: Forbidden. You are not authorized to make this request.

notFound.description: Not found. There is no defined route for the URL you requested, or part of the URL (e.g. a patient id) is not in a valid format.

badMethod.description: Bad method. The URL is correct, but you used the wrong HTTP method, e.g. you tried to POST to a URL that only supports GET.
